edu.memphis.ccrg.lida.framework
Interface ModuleDriver

All Superinterfaces:
Activatible, LidaTask, java.lang.Runnable, TaskSpawner
All Known Implementing Classes:
AttentionDriver, BroadcastQueueDriver, CsmDriver, EnvironmentImpl, EpisodicBufferDriver, ModuleDriverImpl, PamDriver, PerceptualBufferDriver, ProceduralMemoryDriver, SbCodeletDriver, SensoryMemoryDriver, TemDriver, VisionEnvironment
public interface ModuleDriver
extends TaskSpawner

A ModuleDriver is a class that runs a major module of the framework such as PAM or Procedural Memory. The main difference b/w it an a LidaTask is that a LidaTask may not be constantly running while a ModuleDriver is always running.

Author:
Ryan J. McCall
